title: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error msg)
description: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error msg)
OB: When a file is already opened in one editor in the Java Perspective and the user tries to open the same file again in another editor by right-clicking on it and selecting 'Open With' -> 'System Editor', nothing happens. The expected behavior is that a warning message should be displayed in the workbench, informing the user that they may overwrite changes and asking if they want to continue. Alternatively, an error message should be displayed, indicating that all files should be closed first before opening the selected file in another editor. This is believed to be a safety feature to prevent external editing while the file is already opened in the Integrated Development Environment (IDE).
EB: However, there should be a warning message or an error message displayed in the workbench when attempting to open a file that is already opened in another editor.
